Description: Fragment of wall of East Greek pottery dinos; interior glazed; exterior: trace of upper frieze; below, body of a goat to right amid filling ornament; added red midriff, reserved belly stripe. Incised inscription on outside.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See Kerschner 2006, 118. Possibly from the same dinos as British Museum 1924,1201.1028 and 1036, though the trace of the upper band is not closely similar.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 218, no. 55)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 110, pl. XXXIV, no. 321.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.12)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5960 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
